<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 278, 325, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 155, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 278, 904, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/22February/March 20182 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 437, 374]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper. Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 390, 386, 406]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 501, 283, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 575]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate. You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 758, 628]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 598, 88]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 165, 560, 181]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 197, 232, 212]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 225, 380, 243]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 243, 571, 281]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 313, 221, 328]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 333, 748, 370]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 380, 492, 415]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[402, 482, 593, 498]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 514, 152, 528]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 542, 581, 610]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 641, 234, 656]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 663, 590, 696]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[404, 715, 590, 770]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 96, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>

Calculate the time it takes the woman to swim across the river and the distance downstream, \(BC\), that she travels. [4]
